Specimen Type: Formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tissue blocks or unstained slides from FFPE tissue
Purpose: To prepare, stain, and microscopically evaluate tissue specimens for the presence of the BRAF V600E mutation for diagnostic or research use
Container: FFPE tissue block (paraffin block) or positively charged glass slide
Equipment: Bond-Max AutoStainer (or equivalent automated immunostainer), microtome, water bath, block paraffin-embedding station
